intro: Frangula darienensis, commonly known as the Darien buckthorn, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by small, greenish fruits. Its bark and leaves contain anthraquinone compounds, which have been used in traditional medicine. Frangula darienensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
